page.title: 02T O U R I S M
page.content:
A seemingly unlikely place to attract tourists, Stanford Bridge is in fact a very popular place during the summer, with a site for touring caravans as well as a site with 28 residential caravans. Most of these static caravans are owned by people from the West Midlands who come to Stanford to enjoy the peace and quiet and also the fishing in the adjacent river Teme, where competitions are held most weeks during the season.
Also, the Hill Climb at nearby {Shelsley Walsh}brings an influx of caravanners to make use of the facilities of shops, showers and toilets available on the tourer site.
